document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To protect information in networks and supporting information processing facilities from compromise via network access
control.control_objective: Secure, manage and control networks and network devices to prevent unauthorized access and protect information systems and applications

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Networks and network devices should be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
key_requirements: Documentation of network architecture and controls
Logging and monitoring of network activities

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive and detective control protecting information systems and applications from compromise through network access
scope: All organization networks and network segments
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Secure network infrastructure with access controls, encryption, monitoring and documented management

prerequisites.description: Before implementing network security, foundational requirements must be met

required_prerequisites.description: Complete inventory of network devices and connected systems
required_prerequisites.rationale: Must identify all network components to secure them
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.9 - Inventory of information and other associated assets

required_prerequisites.description: Classification of information by sensitivity level
required_prerequisites.rationale: Network security controls aligned with data sensitivity
Network controls implement broader access control policy

required_prerequisites.description: Network security risks identified and assessed
required_prerequisites.rationale: Controls designed to mitigate identified risks
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security

implementation_requirements.description: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of network architecture and configuration

documentation_requirements: Network diagrams showing all network segments and connections
Physical and logical network topology documented
All network devices identified and documented
Network access rules and firewall rules documented
Changes to network configuration documented with dates
documentation_classification: Regular review and update of documentation
data_classification_mapping: Data classification level mapped to networks carrying data

implementation_requirements.description: Document network management roles and assign clear responsibilities

role_definitions: Network security officer - oversees network security
Network change manager - approves network changes
Incident responder - responds to network security incidents
Network auditor - conducts network security audits
responsibility_assignment: Specific personnel assigned to each role
Backup coverage for critical roles defined
Roles segregated to prevent conflicts of interest
access_management_process: Request and approval procedure for network access
Segregation of duty in access approval
Access granted based on documented business need
Access removal when no longer needed

implementation_requirements.description: Deploy technical controls to secure networks and network devices

encryption_controls: Encryption of sensitive data in transit (TLS/SSL)
VPN or encrypted tunnels for remote access
access_control_and_filtering: Access control lists on network devices
Web application firewalls for web traffic
Connection filtering based on business requirements
network_device_hardening: Default passwords changed on all devices
Vulnerable network protocols disabled (telnet, rsh, etc.)
virtual_network_controls: Isolation of virtual networks where appropriate
Virtual network security controls equivalent to physical
Reference to ISO/IEC TS 23167 for guidance

implementation_requirements.description: Establish logging and monitoring of network security-relevant activities

logging_requirements: Firewall logs capturing allowed and denied connections
Administrative access to network devices logged
monitoring_activities: Monitoring of network device health and availability
Correlation of network events with system events
security_information_and_event_managemen: SIEM or similar tool for log aggregation
Correlation of network events across systems
Trend analysis of network security events

implementation_requirements.description: Implement change management for network configuration and devices

change_management_process: All network changes require formal request
change_documentation: Configuration changes logged with date and person
segregation_of_duty: Change request and approval by different persons

implementation_requirements.description: Implement security controls specific to remote access capabilities

remote_access_requirements: VPN or encrypted tunnel required for remote access
Remote access limitations by user role
Geographic or IP-based access restrictions where appropriate
Monitoring of remote access for anomalies
remote_access_documentation: Remote access user roles and permissions
Incident procedures for remote access compromise

implementation_requirements.description: Apply security controls to connections with external parties

third_party_connection_security: Incident response procedures for third-party access
third_party_access_controls: Automatic access removal on contract termination

implementation_requirements.description: Design and implement network segmentation to segregate and protect critical systems

segmentation_strategy: Network segmented by function and criticality
Administrative networks segregated from user networks
segmentation_implementation: Virtual network isolation in cloud environments

implementation_requirements.description: Conduct testing to verify network security controls are functioning

testing_activities: Verify firewall rules are functioning correctly
Verify logging and monitoring are capturing events
testing_frequency: Testing as part of internal audits

steps.detail: Document existing network configuration and identify security gaps
Develop policy documenting network security requirements and standards
Create detailed network diagrams and configuration documentation
Document network management roles and access management process
Deploy firewall and access control at network perimeter
Deploy encryption for sensitive data in transit
Configure network devices with security hardening measures
Deploy SIEM or logging infrastructure for network monitoring
Conduct testing to verify network security controls are operational

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 8.20

checklist.item: Network security policy documented and approved
Network architecture and topology documented with diagrams
Network device inventory and configuration documented
Network data classification and security requirements documented
Roles and responsibilities for network management defined
Access control processes for network access implemented
Network segmentation implemented with documented rules
Encryption implemented for sensitive data in transit
Network devices hardened with default passwords changed
Remote access VPN and controls implemented
Network change management process documented and followed
Third-party network connections secured and documented
Network security testing performed and documented
Internal audit of network security controls conducted

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with network security

mistakes.description: Network documentation is missing, incomplete or outdated creating uncertainty about network configuration and preventing effective security management
root_cause: Network documentation not prioritized in initial setup
Documentation not updated as network changes
No responsibility assigned for maintaining documentation
Poor version control and document management
Rapid network changes without documentation process
mistakes.impact: Auditors cannot verify network security controls, unauthorized changes undetected, security gaps unknown, incident response complicated
prevention: Establish network documentation standards and templates
Assign responsibility for maintaining documentation
Implement version control procedures
Require documentation updates with every change
Schedule quarterly documentation review
Maintain network diagrams with current topology
Store documentation securely and maintain access controls

mistakes.mistake: No network segmentation allowing lateral movement
mistakes.description: Networks not segmented allowing attacker compromise of one system to spread across entire network
root_cause: All systems on same network segment
No firewall rules between network segments
Lack of understanding of segmentation importance
mistakes.impact: Breach in one system allows access to all systems, customer data exposure, game system compromise, regulatory violation
prevention: Design network with multiple segments by function
Segregate critical systems (games, payments, customer data)
Implement firewall rules enforcing segmentation
Monitor traffic between segments for anomalies
Use VLANs for virtual segmentation
Apply principle of least privilege to inter-segment traffic

mistakes.mistake: Inadequate monitoring and logging of network activity
mistakes.description: Network activity not logged or monitored preventing detection of security incidents and intrusions
root_cause: Logging not enabled on firewall or network devices
Log retention too short for investigation
No monitoring of logs for security events
mistakes.impact: Security incidents undetected until damage is done, forensic investigation impossible, compliance failures, regulatory penalties
prevention: Enable logging on all network devices
Collect network logs in centralized system (SIEM)
Configure alerts for suspicious network activity
Establish log retention periods for investigation
Implement regular log review procedures
Correlate network logs with application and system logs
Train personnel to investigate network alerts

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 8.20 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify comprehensive network documentation exists and is current
checks: Network diagrams showing topology and connections exist
Configuration files for network devices documented
Network access rules and firewall rules documented

audit_areas.description: Verify network security aligned with data sensitivity
checks: Security controls aligned with data classification

audit_areas.description: Verify clear definition of network management responsibilities
checks: Access management process for network access defined
Encryption of sensitive data in transit verified

audit_areas.description: Verify network activity logging and monitoring
checks: Firewall logs capturing allowed and denied traffic

audit_areas.description: Verify network changes controlled and documented
checks: Network changes require formal request and approval
Changes documented with dates and person

audit_areas.description: Verify remote access and third-party connections secured
checks: Remote access VPN or encrypted tunnel documented

audit_areas.description: Verify network security for critical gambling systems
checks: Game servers on segregated network segment
RNG systems isolated from external networks
Monitoring of critical system network traffic

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, network security is critical for protecting customer funds, personal data, game integrity and regulatory compliance. UKGC expects comprehensive network documentation, segregation of critical systems, encryption of sensitive data and monitoring of network activity.
specific_requirements: Game servers and RNG systems on segregated network with restricted access
Payment processing systems on dedicated network segment with encryption
Customer data systems segregated with encryption and access controls
Customer account systems segregated from public-facing systems
Network documentation current and available for auditor review
Firewall rules enforcing network segmentation documented
Network monitoring detecting unauthorized access attempts
Remote access secured with VPN and multi-factor authentication
Third-party connections to payment processors secured and monitored
Network changes managed through formal change control process
ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Gambling operators must implement comprehensive network security with documentation, segmentation, encryption, monitoring and change control to protect critical systems and customer data from network-based compromise

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Establish secure, documented and monitored network infrastructure protecting information systems and applications from network-based compromise
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - network security is foundation for protecting all systems; weak network security undermines all other controls
key_principles: Comprehensive network documentation maintained and current
Network segmentation by function and criticality
Encryption of sensitive data in transit
Network device hardening with secure configuration
Logging and monitoring of network activity
Clear roles and responsibilities for network management
Regular testing and verification of controls

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 8.20 Network Security, implement
requirements: Documented network security policy approved by management
Current network diagrams showing topology and all network segments
Complete inventory of network devices with configurations
Data classification mapped to network security requirements
Documented roles and responsibilities for network management
Firewall implemented and configured at network perimeter
Network segmentation with documented firewall rules
Segregation of critical systems: games, payments, customer data
Encryption implemented for sensitive data in transit
Network devices hardened with default passwords changed
Vulnerable network protocols disabled
Network authentication controls in place
Remote access secured with VPN and multi-factor authentication
Network logging and monitoring implemented
SIEM or centralized logging collecting network events
Alerts configured for suspicious network activity
Network change management process documented and followed
Third-party network connections documented and secured
Network security testing performed and documented
Internal audit of network security controls conducted

related_requirements.rts_reference: UK Gambling Commission Remote Technical Standards (RTS) Chapter 4 - Systems and Operational Security

related_controls.relationship: Network access controls implement broader access control policy

related_controls.control: ISO 27001 A 8.1 - Networks and information processing facilities
related_controls.relationship: Network infrastructure must be designed for security
Network events must be logged for investigation and analysis

related_controls.control: ISO 27001 A 8.21 - Security of network services
related_controls.relationship: Network services must be secured individually
Network segmentation as specific implementation of network security

network_design_best_practices: Design networks with security in mind from the start
Segment networks by function, criticality and data sensitivity
Use defense-in-depth approach with multiple security layers
Isolate critical systems (games, payments) from other networks
Restrict administrative networks from user networks
Use VPNs for remote access and third-party connections
Implement network zones based on security requirements
firewall_and_access_control_best_practic: Implement firewall at network perimeter and between segments
Use default-deny rule set allowing only necessary traffic
Document and justify all firewall rules
Regularly review and clean up unused rules
Implement application-layer firewall for critical applications
Use intrusion prevention systems for threat detection
Configure firewall high availability and failover
Monitor firewall performance and resource utilization
network_device_hardening_best_practices: Remove or disable default user accounts
Disable unnecessary network services and features
Disable vulnerable protocols (Telnet, SNMP v1/v2, HTTP)
Use SSH instead of Telnet for remote access
Implement strong authentication for administrative access
Monitor for and respond to security advisories
monitoring_and_logging_best_practices: Enable logging on all network devices
Collect logs in centralized SIEM system
Retain network logs for sufficient period for investigation
Establish procedures for monitoring and alert review
Correlate network logs with system and application logs
Use behavioral analytics to detect anomalies
Generate regular reports on network security metrics

gambling_operator_specific_guidance.critical_system_segregation: Game servers and RNG systems must be on segregated networks with restricted access. Payment processing systems must be on dedicated network segments with encryption. Customer data systems must be segregated from public-facing systems. Network segregation is critical for protecting game integrity and customer data.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.payment_system_protection: Network connections to payment processors must be encrypted and monitored. Payment gateway traffic must be on dedicated network segment. Firewall rules must restrict payment system access to authorized systems only. Network monitoring must alert on unusual payment system traffic.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.customer_data_protection: Customer data systems must be segregated from operational networks. Network access to customer data must be restricted and logged. Encryption must protect customer data in transit. Network segmentation prevents unauthorized access to customer information.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.remote_access_security: All remote access must use VPN with encryption. Multi-factor authentication required for remote access. Remote access must be restricted to specific network segments. Monitoring and logging of all remote access sessions required.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.compliance_documentation: Network diagrams and configuration documentation must be current and available. Firewall rules and access control lists must be documented. Network changes must be documented with approval. Documentation must be reviewed during UKGC audits.
gambling_operator_specific_guidance.audit_readiness: To be audit-ready: provide current network diagrams; provide firewall rule documentation; demonstrate network segmentation; provide firewall and network logs; show monitoring evidence; demonstrate testing of network controls; show approval for all network changes; provide third-party connection security documentation.
